unit.utterance: Ipiatlak, Etasrik, Ratison. Etasrik ipiatlak mtulep iskei itkos.
unit.utterance_translation: There is (a natopu at) Tassiriki, the Radison. Tassiriki has a woman spirit there.

unit.utterance: Ga me itkos. Nagien ipi Lisau.
unit.utterance_translation: She is there. Her name is Lisau.

unit.utterance: Ga me itu lekor ga esa.
unit.utterance_translation: She looks after this place.

unit.utterance: Rupi natopu me rutae nam̃er, rutae natam̃ol ni natkon, lekor ptaki natam̃ol.
unit.utterance_translation: They are natopu but they know people, they know the people of the village, look after the people.

unit.utterance: Tenen kin ipreg tenamrun itakel, kefo peikin kin teflan kin itae na ipreg namrun itakel, ipeikin ki.
unit.utterance_translation: Anyone who does something crooked, they show her so that she knows that he is doing something.

unit.utterance: Go natam̃ol ito mrotae na tenen kin ipregi, ita wi mau.
unit.utterance_translation: And the man will recognise that what he did is not good.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] Me ipiatlak natam̃ol nen rutuer tete nanromien?
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] But are there people who give them some presents?

unit.utterance: Or. Or. Wel, namroan sa ni natam̃ol, natam̃ol imrosaki tete natam̃ol imrosaki tete aslen,
unit.utterance_translation: Yes. Yes. Like, evil thoughts, if a man wishes bad things on someone, he wishes bad things on some friend.

unit.utterance: isel tete nanromien ipan tua ki. Ina, "P̃afo neu, p̃afo neu watgi."
unit.utterance_translation: he takes a present, he goes and gives it to her. He says, "You will hit him for me.'

unit.utterance: Kefo pregi taosikin, taosi natam̃ol nen isel nanromien ipan tua ki.
unit.utterance_translation: She will do it, as that man brought a small present and gave it to her.

unit.utterance: Malen kin natam̃ol kaaru nen ifla tu msak, nlaken kin tekaaru kipe pan tu natopu ki.
unit.utterance_translation: Then that other man might get sick, because the other one went and gave the natopu a present.

unit.utterance: Ifla tu msak, panpan ale ilel na, tete munwei nen ketae ga pam̃or nlak namsaki ga.
unit.utterance_translation: If he is sick, eventually he will go and see a healer who will be able to find out for him the cause of his sickness.

unit.utterance: Pan kefo tli na, kefo tae nrikin ki na, "Ga kin itu natopu kik'"
unit.utterance_translation: Then he will tell him, "He is the one who gave you to the natopu.'

unit.utterance: Go ga kefo mer tae nrikin ki na, 'P̃amer sel tete nanromien mai tao kin, me kineu kafo pan ga psi, me kafo plakek ler.'
unit.utterance_translation: And he (the healer) would then be able to tell him, "You go now and get a present and give it to me, and I will go and give it to her and I will come back with you.'

unit.utterance: Tefla. Ipitlak tete natam̃ol nen kin namroan gar itakel, ruto.
unit.utterance_translation: That's it. There are some people who don't think straight.

unit.utterance: Me ita pi sup̃ wi mau, ipi sup̃ sa.
unit.utterance_translation: But it is not a good way, it's a bad way.

unit.utterance: [AUDIENCE] Me natopu ipi natopu sa, ko iwi?
unit.utterance_translation: [AUDIENCE] But is the Natopu good or bad?

unit.utterance: Iwi inrom, inrom ser natam̃ol, me malen kin naat iskei imaetki aslen, me ipan tua tete nanromien ga kefo pregi
unit.utterance_translation: She is good, she loves all people, but when a man gets angry with his friend and he gives her a present, she will do it.

unit.utterance: Taosi kin nanromien nen rupan tua kin
unit.utterance_translation: Like, the present that they gave her.

unit.utterance: Itefla. Natopu itefla.
unit.utterance_translation: It's like that. The natopu is like that.
